articles.image_title: BERLIN, GERMANY - AUGUST 15: German Economy and Climate Action Minister Robert Habeck speaks to the media to announce the German government's move to allow utilities to raise the price for consumers for natural gas on August 15, 2022 in Berlin, Germany. The price will rise by 2.4 Euro cents per KwH and is meant to help utilities who are now forced to buy gas at much higher market prices due to Russia's reduction of gas exports.
